com.github.fge.jackson

Class JsonLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fge.jackson.JsonLoader

  • public final class JsonLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to load JSON values from various sources as JsonNodes.

    This class uses a JsonNodeReader to parse JSON inputs.

    See Also:
    JsonNodeReader

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • fromResource

        public static JsonNode fromResource(@Nonnull
                                    java.lang.String resource)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Read a JsonNode from a resource path.

        This method first tries and loads the resource using Class.getResource(String); if not found, is tries and uses the context classloader and if this is not found, this class's classloader.

        This method throws an IOException if the resource does not exist.

        Parameters:
        resource - the path to the resource (must begin with a /)
        Returns:
        the JSON document at the resource
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - resource path does not begin with a /
        java.io.IOException - there was a problem loading the resource, or the JSON document is invalid

      • fromURL

        public static JsonNode fromURL(java.net.URL url)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Read a JsonNode from an URL.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL to fetch the JSON document from
        Returns:
        The document at that URL
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of network problems etc.

      • fromPath

        public static JsonNode fromPath(java.lang.String path)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Read a JsonNode from a file on the local filesystem.
        Parameters:
        path - the path (relative or absolute) to the file
        Returns:
        the document in the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this is not a file, if it cannot be read, etc.

      • fromFile

        public static JsonNode fromFile(java.io.File file)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Same as fromPath(String), but this time the user supplies the File object instead
        Parameters:
        file - the File object
        Returns:
        The document
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in many cases!

      • fromReader

        public static JsonNode fromReader(java.io.Reader reader)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Read a JsonNode from a user supplied Reader
        Parameters:
        reader - The reader
        Returns:
        the document
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the reader has problems

        Read a JsonNode from a string input
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the document
        Throws:
